page.title: 07Palmer's Farm 1
page.content: From an interview with Mr.McCheyne of Palmer's Farm. Mr. McCheyne farms approximately 130 acres from the brook northwards and his brother farms the remainder of the land in the north-west of our block. Now semi-retired, he has been in farming all his life.When his father was killed by a V1 bomb in the fields in front of the house,in 1943,the two brothers took over the running of the farm. The farm no longer supports a dairy herd, since the introduction of herd testation,and the original cropping of sugar beet, potatoes and oats has been simplified to a wheat, barley and oilseed rape rotation,which involves less hard work.
